question: 阪神
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>slope</kanji>s of the <kanji>god</kanji>s! What could this be? Well, it's mainly just a company, known as <vocabulary>Hanshin</vocabulary>. They're based in the area between Osaka and Kobe. Think of it this way: <ja>大阪</ja> + <ja>神戸</ja> = <ja>阪神</ja>! They're everywhere, though, and even have a baseball team (the Hanshin Tigers), so it's good to know.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
